newsitem.title: USA: U.S. senators call for major overhaul of ISTEA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. senators call for major overhaul of ISTEA.

text.p: Fifty-three U.S. Senators on Monday called for a major overhaul of funding formulas under the nation's six-year-old surface transportation funding law.

"It's time for a new mix of ingredients in the Intermodal Surface Transportation Efficiency Act (ISTEA)," legislators said in a one-page letter to Sen. John Chafee, R.I., chairman of the Senate Environment and Public Works Committee.
Chafee backed a limited revision of the multi-billion dollar law.

But the 53 senators headed by Sens. Bob Graham, D-Fl., and Richard Lugar, R-Ind., said it is time for a major rewrite of funding formulas, including giving states more discretion in spending federal dollars.
"This is really important," a Senate aide said of Monday's letter. He said it is the first time in six years that a majority of the senators have "spoken with one voice" on the issue.
The 1991 federal aid program is scheduled to expire in September.
